header.title: ESOTERIC EXTENSION OF TAROT TO DEVELOP SUPERSENSORY POWERS

central_thesis: This text posits that the Sun, represented by Tarot Key 19, is a primary spiritual fact and the source of creative energy and love. By understanding the Qabalistic connection between the Sun (Tiphareth), the union of masculine and feminine aspects, and the concept of 'Adam' as generic humanity, individuals can develop supersensory powers and spiritual awareness through conscious connection and practical techniques that integrate spirit and the physical.

structure_content.chapter_title: LESSON 49: ESOTERIC EXTENSION OF TAROT TO DEVELOP SUPERSENSORY POWERS
structure_content.summary: This lesson explores Tarot Key 19 (The Sun) through a Qabalistic lens, linking it to Tiphareth, Beauty, and Christ Consciousness. It contrasts materialism with the spiritual view of the physical as a divine expression, emphasizing that the physical plane is a spiritual fact. The solar rays (wavy for feminine, straight for masculine) symbolize the union of these aspects, producing offspring in their image, as seen in the Key's imagery of a boy and girl in a magic fairy ring. The lesson introduces 'Adam' as generic humanity and the Sun as the conscious goal of evolution. It discusses the experience of being permeated by light and love, comparing it to a solar sea accessible through an inner heart center. The text asserts that one's inner state manifests externally, and to receive love, one must first become love. It highlights the dual wave-particle nature of energy and consciousness, and the interconnectedness of all beings as rays of the Sun. The lesson concludes with a practical technique involving visualization of the solar color orange, invoking the Sun's light and love, and affirming oneself as a ray of the Greater Self, continuously radiating love.

key_concepts.definition: The Sephirah on the Tree of Life assigned to the Sun, representing Beauty, Christ Consciousness, Redeemer, and the sphere of activity of the Sun. It is also called 'Adam' (generic humanity).
The doctrine that the physical world is not an illusion or delusion, but a real manifestation of the spiritual, created by God. To disparage the physical is to speak against God, the creator of all.

Symbolized by straight rays (masculine) and wavy rays (feminine) emanating from the Sun in Key 19. They represent the union of masculine and feminine consciousness in love, producing offspring in their image.
An alternative name for Tiphareth, signifying humanity as a whole and the goal of evolution, rather than an individual man.

An analogy for the pervasive, life-sustaining energy of love emanating from the Sun, accessible through an inner heart center. Every human being is connected to this sea, regardless of their perceived isolation.

The evolved state of human consciousness, contrasted with Homo sapiens. It is achieved through the activity and energy of the Sun, leading to an awareness of being a living, conscious part of all-pervading light.

Emotions (like love or fear) and energy are described as having a wave-like quality, akin to electromagnetic energy, and can be experienced as surges. This also relates to the wave-particle duality of energy.
The ultimate source of all being and consciousness, symbolized by the Sun. Individual consciousnesses are specialized rays of this central consciousness, eternal and never lost.

practical_system.description: The practical system involves cultivating a conscious awareness of the Sun as a source of love and light, and recognizing oneself as a specialized ray of this divine consciousness. It emphasizes becoming 'love' internally, which then manifests externally. The core technique involves visualization and affirmation to integrate solar energy, specifically the masculine and feminine aspects represented by straight and wavy rays, and to foster a continuous flow of love and light between oneself and the Sun, and out into the world. This process aims to develop supersensory awareness and a deeper connection to the 'homo spiritualis' state.
rituals: Immersion in the color orange (the color of Key 19).
Visualization of oneself within a magic fairy ring with a boy and girl.
Raising arms and calling to the 'Sun of Light and Life' for the subconscious mind, invoking love and awakening.
Visualizing a golden wavy ray of light from the Sun permeating the figure of the little girl.
Raising arms and praying for conscious awareness of the 'eternal immortal Selfhood', seeing God in all expressions.
Visualizing a golden straight ray of light from the Sun permeating the figure of the little boy.
Mentally activating the orange Yod between the girl and boy with golden light from the Sun.
Visualizing the light spreading as a halo encompassing the boy and girl.
Directing the light into one's heart center.
Raising arms a third time to send the filled Love and Light out into all of life.

Reciting the affirmation: 'Oh, Sun of Life and Light, I send out to you and to all of life, the Love that you give so freely. I am permeated with your light, I am permeated with your love. Through my personality, a ray of Thy Greater Self, I continuously radiate Love into Life, blessing every form, every center, every expression of Thy eternal creativity.'

relevant_quotes.text: The whole tradition of the Qabalistic school is to consciously bring spirit in and through the physical. The physical plane is a spiritual fact to the Qabalist and this is important to remember. The physical plane is a spiritual fact; it is not an illusion or delusion.

Whenever you see wavy rays or anything curved it symbolizes the female aspect. The straight ray symbolizes the male aspect. You are told by the shape of these rays that the consciousness behind the spiritual Sun is really both masculine and feminine, and that masculine and feminine are in union through love.

Therefore we see here symbolically represented something that is of the utmost importance for us, not only to know but to practice knowing every moment of our lives. That is, that basically, we human beings are consciously the goal of the evolution brought about by the action of what in the physical outer world appears to be the ball of fire that we call the Sun.

For love is truly what we must learn to see the Sun as, and nothing that interprets that extraordinary creative activity as anything except love can begin to reach the vital consciousness that we seek.

That is why the sun center near the heart is aware of love. Through this center you can experience love in the form of waves. Remember, we are all attached in a strange way to the solar sea of love, just as the umbilical cord attaches the embryo to the mother, although the analogy is not exact.

Every habitual thought and emotion must manifest, and the reason that there are so many failures in elementary metaphysics, when attempts are made to demonstrate various things, is because so many do not work at becoming the thing that they want.

We are each a ray, a specialization, a marvelous specialization of the Central Consciousness which we call the Sun. This specialized consciousness is eternal and is never lost. Why is this? Because we are offspring of the Sun.

Even when we drop the physical form, we still have an astral form; we still have a mental form, and we are individualized beings. We are children of the Sun. We are begotten of the Sun of light and love.

You are connected with the Sun, as a ray of the Sun, through your heart center, the Sun that is the core of your individuality and your eternal being. You are, therefore, immersed in the love of God; it is your obligation to begin really to love God, and you do not really love God if you do not love God's other children and other creations.

critical_analysis.relevance: This text offers a sophisticated esoteric interpretation of Tarot Key 19, integrating Qabalistic principles with concepts of consciousness, love, and the spiritual nature of the physical. It provides a framework for understanding oneself as a divine emanation and developing higher awareness and supersensory abilities. Its emphasis on the union of opposites and the pervasive nature of love aligns with many mystical traditions.
critical_analysis.target_audience: This work is aimed at students and practitioners of esoteric arts, particularly those familiar with Tarot and Qabalah, who are seeking to deepen their spiritual understanding and develop psychic or supersensory faculties. It is suited for individuals interested in the metaphysical underpinnings of reality and the integration of spiritual and physical existence.
